items.title: 'It wasn't your fault': Ben Austin's parents offer support for other boy involved in cricket tragedy
items.description: Ben Austin died after a cricket ball struck him in late October. For the first time his parents speak exclusively about the incident and their belief no one is to blame for the tragic accident.

items.title: Live: Trump accused of lying about reason for Venezuela attack
items.description: As Nicolás Maduro and his wife face court in New York after being captured by US forces, House Democrats leader Hakeem Jeffries has accused US President Donald Trump of lying to the American people about the reason for the attack. Follow live.

items.title: 'It's going down': Trump names four places he could hit next
items.description: Donald Trump is talking about where US forces might venture next. But one of his cabinet secretaries could provide the clearest clues.

items.title: Venezuela is a 'powder keg' after US attack. Here's what could come next
items.description: The US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro left the country with an uncertain future, sparked concern among regional neighbours and could embolden other countries in territorial disputes, some experts say.

items.title: Calls for a royal commission into Bondi an untenable political distraction
items.description: Whether or not Anthony Albanese believes a federal royal commission is necessary, or even the best use of resources, is now politically irrelevant.

items.title: PM doesn't rule out royal commission into Bondi terror attack
items.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese does not rule out calling a royal commission into the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, but says his immediate priority is the review of intelligence and security agencies.

items.title: Clark denies confrontation with CA boss after interview ban
items.description: Stuart Clark opens up on his conversation with Cricket Australia chief Todd Greenberg after his stinging criticism.

items.title: Man charged in connection to alleged Hanukkah car arson in Melbourne
items.description: A man is charged after an alleged arson attack on a vehicle with a Hanukkah decoration on Christmas morning in Melbourne's south-east.

items.title: Smith treats Sydney to a Smudge Day, in all its weird and wonderful glory
items.description: Steve Smith was at his bizarre best on day three in Sydney, grinding England into the dust with his scintillating strokeplay and trademark oddness.

items.title: Tributes flow for National Party stalwart after death at home overnight
items.description: Known as "Bozzie" to his mates and colleagues, Mr Boswell's political career spanned three decades.

items.title: EU, Britain condemn sexualised deepfake images spreading on X
items.description: A digital undressing spree on Elon Musk's social media site has prompted investigations from countries including France, India and Malaysia.

items.title: Sam Groth to relinquish deputy Liberal leadership next month
items.description: The outgoing MP will vacate the deputy leadership role in February, clearing the way for a refreshed leadership team to carry the opposition to this year's election.

items.title: Kyrgios proud but disappointed as reality of his failing body hits home
items.description: Nick Kyrgios limped out of the Brisbane International at the first hurdle as the 30-year-old's ailing body lets him down once again.

items.title: Human remains found in search for missing snorkeller in WA
items.description: Police confirm human remains have been found washed ashore north of Perth, believed to be those of a 32-year-old man missing since New Year's Day.

items.title: LA-like fires could hit Australian capital cities, report warns
items.description: Australia's capital cities are increasingly at risk of being affected by a major fire like the one that ravaged Los Angeles last year, according to a new climate report.

items.title: Police commissioner extends protest restrictions in NSW
items.description: The NSW police commissioner will extend temporary protest restrictions across Sydney for another two weeks.

items.title: BlueScope shares rocket higher on $13 billion Stokes bid
items.description: Kerry Stokes-controlled firm SGH has launched a $13.2 billion takeover bid for BlueScope Steel, in partnership with a US steelmaker.

items.title: Libraries have bounced back after COVID. Here's how they did it
items.description: Public libraries in Australia are experimenting with inventive ways to attract new members — but a lack of funding means they must do more with less.

items.title: Aboriginal mother of five identified after death in NT police watch house
items.description: A Sydney-based law firm says it is representing the family of a 44-year-old Aboriginal woman who died in custody at the Tennant Creek police watch house.

items.title: Mickey Rourke launches fundraiser to pay $89,000 in rent
items.description: The actor, who faced accusations of homophobia and inappropriate behaviour on set last year, could now lose his home.

items.title: Farmer considers selling up because of red tape on hosting campers
items.description: A Scenic Rim farmer says the costs of getting a council permit to host campers are so high he may have to sell his property.

items.title: NSW farmers say 10-gun limit not enough and may create safety risk
items.description: New gun laws in NSW will limit farmers to 10 guns but the industry says this is not enough, and the change could see "a whole lot more firearms and ammunition" moving between farms in vehicles.

items.title: Sinkholes could be forming for years before a sudden collapse. Here's why
items.description: The sudden collapse of a sinkhole in Melbourne's north-east left residents shocked on Tuesday. Here's an explanation of how and why they form.

items.title: Doctors slam US cut to vaccines recommended for children
items.description: The US government takes the unprecedented step of cutting the number of vaccines it recommends for every child, a move long sought by Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr. But medical groups say it undermines protections against diseases.

items.title: Cocos Keeling Islands endure second tropical cyclone in less than two weeks
items.description: Residents of the islands clean up following heavy rain and winds brought by Tropical Cyclone Jenna, less than two weeks another system battered the region on Christmas day.
